data.name: Model
data.body:
{
  "tools": [
    {
      "id": "53",
      "name": "Bottle",
      "summary": "Bottle is a fast, simple and lightweight WSGI micro web-framework for Python. It is distributed as a single file module and has no dependencies other than the Python Standard Library.\n\nRouting: Requests to function-call mapping with support for clean and dynamic URLs.\nTemplates: Fast and pythonic built-in template engine and support for mako, jinja",
      "details": "Bottle is a fast, simple and lightweight WSGI micro web-framework for Python. It is distributed as a single file module and has no dependencies other than the Python Standard Library.\n\nRouting: Requests to function-call mapping with support for clean and dynamic URLs.\nTemplates: Fast and pythonic built-in template engine and support for mako, jinja2 andcheetah templates.\nUtilities: Convenient access to form data, file uploads, cookies, headers and other HTTP-related metadata.\nServer: Built-in HTTP development server and support for paste, fapws3, bjoern, Google App Engine, cherrypy or any other WSGI capable HTTP server.\n",
      "website": "http://bottlepy.org/docs/dev/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/bottle-logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,API-Deployment,Framework,Python"
    },
    {
      "id": "4",
      "name": "CherryPy",
      "summary": "CherryPy is a pythonic, object-oriented HTTP framework, that allows developers to build web applications in much the same way they would build any other object-oriented Python program. This results in smaller source code developed in less time.\nCherryPy is now more than six years old and it is has proven very fast and stable. It is being used in production by many sites, from the simplest one",
      "details": "CherryPy is a pythonic, object-oriented HTTP framework, that allows developers to build web applications in much the same way they would build any other object-oriented Python program. This results in smaller source code developed in less time.\nCherryPy is now more than six years old and it is has proven very fast and stable. It is being used in production by many sites, from the simplest ones to the most demanding ones.",
      "website": "http://www.cherrypy.org/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/cherrypy_logo_big.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Python"
    },
    {
      "id": "3",
      "name": "Dave",
      "summary": "DAVE is a minimalist, multi-node, transactional API framework written in PHP.Dave contains an end-to-end API test suite for TDD, a Task model, an Active Database Model, and a stand-alone development server ( PHP) to get you started.DAVE is an acronym that stands for Delete, Add, Edit, and View. These 4 methods make up the core functionality of many transactional web applications. The DAVE API aims",
      "details": "DAVE is a minimalist, multi-node, transactional API framework written in PHP.Dave contains an end-to-end API test suite for TDD, a Task model, an Active Database Model, and a stand-alone development server ( PHP) to get you started.DAVE is an acronym that stands for Delete, Add, Edit, and View. These 4 methods make up the core functionality of many transactional web applications. The DAVE API aims to simplify and abstract may of the common tasks that these types of APIs require. DAVE does the work for you, and he's not CRUD. Dave was built to be both easy to use, but to be as simple as possible. I was tired of bloated frameworks that were designed to be monolithic applications which include M's, V's, and C's together in a single running application. As applications grow and become more 'service oriented', this is the eventual route which many applications go. I wanted to make is as simple as possible to create a new application with this mindset, and to allow for future flexibility.The DAVE API defines a single access point and accepts GET, POST, or COOKIE input. You define \"Action's\" that handle the input, such as \"AddUser\" or \"GeoLocate\". The DAVE API is NOT \"RESTful\", in that it does not use the normal verbs (Get, Put, etc) and uses a single /path/. This was chosen to make it as simple as possible for devices/users to access the functions, including low-level embedded devices which may have trouble with all the HTTP verbs. To see how simple it is to handle basic actions, this package comes with a basic user system included. Look in /Actions/examples to see the logic behind adding, editing, viewing, and deleting users. This includes log in. Restful paths are optional if you really must have them, and be defined per Action.The DAVE API understands 2 types of security methodology. \"Public\" actions can be called by anyone, and then can implement optional user-based security (checking userIDs and PasswordHashes?). Optionally, certain Actions can be defined as \"Private\", and will require a defined developer to authenticate with every request. This requires your developers to provide an MD5 hash of their APIKey and private DeveloperID to authenticate with. You can mix private and public actions. Of course, you can make your own actions for this as well!Dave contains an end-to-end API test suite for TDD, a Task model, an Active Database Model, and a stand-alone development server (written in just PHP) to get you started.",
      "website": "https://github.com/evantahler/PHP-DAVE-API",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/github-logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,PHP"
    },
    {
      "id": "5",
      "name": "Django Rest",
      "summary": "Django REST framework is a lightweight REST framework for Django, that aims to make it easy to build well-connected, self-describing RESTful Web APIs.Features Include:\n\nAutomatically provides an awesome Django admin style browse-able self-documenting API.\nClean, simple, views for Resources, using Django’s new class based views.\nSupport for ModelResources with out-of-the-box default implement",
      "details": "Django REST framework is a lightweight REST framework for Django, that aims to make it easy to build well-connected, self-describing RESTful Web APIs.Features Include:\n\nAutomatically provides an awesome Django admin style browse-able self-documenting API.\nClean, simple, views for Resources, using Django’s new class based views.\nSupport for ModelResources with out-of-the-box default implementations and input validation.\nPluggable parsers, renderers, authentication and permissions - Easy to customise.\nContent type negotiation using HTTP Accept headers.\nOptional support for forms as input validation.\nModular architecture - MixIn classes can be used without requiring the Resource or ModelResource classes.\n",
      "website": "http://django-rest-framework.org/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/Django-REST-Framework-Logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Django,Framework,Python"
    },
    {
      "id": "2",
      "name": "Epiphany",
      "summary": "The Epiphany framework is fast, easy, clean and RESTful. The framework does not do a lot of magic under the hood. It is, by design, very simple and very powerful.The documentation provides a few conventions that we believe lead to well written code but you're free to use any style you'd like. The framework never dictates how you should write or structure your application.",
      "details": "The Epiphany framework is fast, easy, clean and RESTful. The framework does not do a lot of magic under the hood. It is, by design, very simple and very powerful.The documentation provides a few conventions that we believe lead to well written code but you're free to use any style you'd like. The framework never dictates how you should write or structure your application.",
      "website": "https://github.com/jmathai/epiphany#readme",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/github-logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,PHP"
    },
    {
      "id": "6",
      "name": "Flask",
      "summary": "Flask is a microframework for Python based on Werkzeug, Jinja 2 and good intentions. And before you ask: It's BSD licensed!\nFlask’s documentation is divided into different parts.  They recommend that you get started with Installation and then head over to the Quickstart. Besides the quickstart there is also a more detailed Tutorial that shows how to create a com",
      "details": "Flask is a microframework for Python based on Werkzeug, Jinja 2 and good intentions. And before you ask: It's BSD licensed!\nFlask’s documentation is divided into different parts.  They recommend that you get started with Installation and then head over to the Quickstart. Besides the quickstart there is also a more detailed Tutorial that shows how to create a complete (albeit small) application with Flask. If you’d rather dive into the internals of Flask, check out the APIdocumentation. Common patterns are described in the Patterns for Flask section.\nFlask depends on two external libraries: the Jinja2 template engine and the Werkzeug WSGI toolkit. These libraries are not documented here. ",
      "website": "http://flask.pocoo.org/docs/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/flask-python-framework.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Python"
    },
    {
      "id": "1",
      "name": "FRAPI",
      "summary": "FRAPI is a new type of framework that embraces the standards and mindset of how the web is modeled. Instead of being a general purpose framework like the Zend Framework, Symfony, Cake, Lithium, etc. which are great for building web applications, FRAPI aims at removing the whole frontend layer complexity that handling REST calls can bring.\nFRAPI is a RESTful API Framework that allows developers to ",
      "details": "FRAPI is a new type of framework that embraces the standards and mindset of how the web is modeled. Instead of being a general purpose framework like the Zend Framework, Symfony, Cake, Lithium, etc. which are great for building web applications, FRAPI aims at removing the whole frontend layer complexity that handling REST calls can bring.\nFRAPI is a RESTful API Framework that allows developers to rapidly develop RESTful APIs that are easily scalable and highly performant. FRAPI consists of two specific parts: The administration interface and the public API.",
      "website": "http://getfrapi.com/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/FRAPI-Framwork.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,PHP,Zend"
    },
    {
      "id": "36",
      "name": "Grape",
      "summary": "Grape is a REST-like API micro-framework for Ruby. It's designed to run on Rack or complement existing web application frameworks such as Rails and Sinatra by providing a simple DSL to easily develop RESTful APIs. It has built-in support for common conventions, including multiple formats, subdomain/prefix restriction, content negotiation, versioning and much more.",
      "details": "Grape is a REST-like API micro-framework for Ruby. It's designed to run on Rack or complement existing web application frameworks such as Rails and Sinatra by providing a simple DSL to easily develop RESTful APIs. It has built-in support for common conventions, including multiple formats, subdomain/prefix restriction, content negotiation, versioning and much more.",
      "website": "http://rdoc.info/github/intridea/grape",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/download-github-logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Ruby"
    },
    {
      "id": "28",
      "name": "Limonade",
      "summary": "Limonade is a PHP micro framework for rapid web development and prototyping.  It’s inspired by frameworks like Sinatra or Camping in Ruby, or Orbit in Lua. It aims to be simple, lightweight and extremly flexible.",
      "details": "Limonade is a PHP micro framework for rapid web development and prototyping.  It’s inspired by frameworks like Sinatra or Camping in Ruby, or Orbit in Lua. It aims to be simple, lightweight and extremly flexible.",
      "website": "http://www.limonade-php.net/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/limonade.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Limonade,PHP,REST"
    },
    {
      "id": "51",
      "name": "Pylons",
      "summary": "The Pylons Project was founded by the people behind the Pylons web framework to develop web application framework technology in Python. Rather than focusing on a single web framework, the Pylons Project will develop a collection of related technologies. The first package is the Pyramid web framework.",
      "details": "The Pylons Project was founded by the people behind the Pylons web framework to develop web application framework technology in Python. Rather than focusing on a single web framework, the Pylons Project will develop a collection of related technologies. The first package is the Pyramid web framework.",
      "website": "http://www.pylonsproject.org/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/Pylons-Logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Python,REST"
    },
    {
      "id": "18",
      "name": "Recess",
      "summary": "Recess is a RESTful PHP framework that can be used by both beginner and seasoned developers. Recess is fast, light-weight, and has a very small footprint—ideal for LAMP development and drag-and-drop deployment to shared hosts. Recess is a modern framework that uses a loosely-coupled Model-View-Controller architecture designed and optimized specifically for PHP 5.",
      "details": "Recess is a RESTful PHP framework that can be used by both beginner and seasoned developers. Recess is fast, light-weight, and has a very small footprint—ideal for LAMP development and drag-and-drop deployment to shared hosts. Recess is a modern framework that uses a loosely-coupled Model-View-Controller architecture designed and optimized specifically for PHP 5.",
      "website": "http://www.recessframework.org/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/Recess-PHP-Framework-150x50.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,PHP,REST"
    },
    {
      "id": "45",
      "name": "Resteasy",
      "summary": "Resteasy is a JBoss.org project aimed at providing productivity frameworks for developing client and server RESTful applications and services in Java.  It is mainly a JAX-RS implementation but you'll find some other experimental code in the repository.",
      "details": "Resteasy is a JBoss.org project aimed at providing productivity frameworks for developing client and server RESTful applications and services in Java.  It is mainly a JAX-RS implementation but you'll find some other experimental code in the repository.",
      "website": "http://www.jboss.org/resteasy",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/REST-Easy.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Java,REST"
    },
    {
      "id": "47",
      "name": "RestFixture",
      "summary": "The RestFixture is a FitNesse fixture that allows developers, testers, and/or product owners to write test fixtures for REST API with simplicity in mind. The idea is to write tests that are self-documenting and easy to write and read, without the need to write Java code.\nThe fixture allows test writers to express tests as actions (using any of the allowed HTTP methods) to ",
      "details": "The RestFixture is a FitNesse fixture that allows developers, testers, and/or product owners to write test fixtures for REST API with simplicity in mind. The idea is to write tests that are self-documenting and easy to write and read, without the need to write Java code.\nThe fixture allows test writers to express tests as actions (using any of the allowed HTTP methods) to operate on resource URIs and to express expectations about the content of the return code, headers and body. All without writing one single line of Java code!",
      "website": "https://github.com/smartrics/RestFixture/wiki",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/download-github-logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Java,REST"
    },
    {
      "id": "41",
      "name": "Restify",
      "summary": "restify is a node.js module built specifically to enable you to build correct REST web services. It intentionally borrows heavily from express as that is more or less the de facto API for writing web applications on top of node.js.",
      "details": "restify is a node.js module built specifically to enable you to build correct REST web services. It intentionally borrows heavily from express as that is more or less the de facto API for writing web applications on top of node.js.",
      "website": "http://mcavage.github.com/node-restify/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/Restify-Logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Node.js,REST"
    },
    {
      "id": "38",
      "name": "RESTkit",
      "summary": "RestKit is an Objective-C framework for iOS that aims to make interacting with RESTful web services simple, fast and fun. It combines a clean, simple HTTP request/response API with a powerful object mapping system that reduces the amount of code you need to write to get stuff done.",
      "details": "RestKit is an Objective-C framework for iOS that aims to make interacting with RESTful web services simple, fast and fun. It combines a clean, simple HTTP request/response API with a powerful object mapping system that reduces the amount of code you need to write to get stuff done.",
      "website": "http://restkit.org/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/RestKit-Logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Objective-C"
    },
    {
      "id": "26",
      "name": "Restler",
      "summary": "A RESTful API server framework that is written in PHP that aids your mobile / web / desktop applications. A framework, but with a difference – Restler is all here to bend and mend to your needs.\nWriting Server made easy and light. With the light weight, Restler makes writing a server as easy as writing it with just 3 PHP files.\nRestler’s advantage is the simplicity. You can create a PH",
      "details": "A RESTful API server framework that is written in PHP that aids your mobile / web / desktop applications. A framework, but with a difference – Restler is all here to bend and mend to your needs.\nWriting Server made easy and light. With the light weight, Restler makes writing a server as easy as writing it with just 3 PHP files.\nRestler’s advantage is the simplicity. You can create a PHP class with some functions to expose.  If you know how to write object oriented PHP, then you already know how to use Restler. It’s action speaks for its effectiveness.\nRestler is all about being light and easy. All public methods are automatically mapped to a URL Tailor-made Restler is known for the customization options. You just need to write class and add methods in PHP. It is just there!.\nRestler makes it effective and facilitates your customizing needs. It goes ahead to leverage your designing creativities. A plugin architecture is used:\n\nfor supporting different formats like json, xml, yaml, amf, plist is used, which also means that you can add your own formats easily\nfor supporting different authentication schemes and you can add your own auth plugin\n\nWhile designing your application, RESTful server makes use of the Web’s well known architecture to your benefit.\nYou just need to simply declare the function as protected and add an authentication class Most of all, an obvious benefit with Restler is, it is free and open sourced.",
      "website": "http://luracast.com/products/restler/",
      "logo": "",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,PHP"
    },
    {
      "id": "42",
      "name": "Restlet",
      "summary": "Restlet is a lightweight, comprehensive, open source REST framework for the Java platform. Restlet is suitable for both server and client Web applications. It supports major Internet transport, data format, and service description standards like HTTP and HTTPS, SMTP, XML, JSON, Atom, and WADL. A GWT port of the client-side ",
      "details": "Restlet is a lightweight, comprehensive, open source REST framework for the Java platform. Restlet is suitable for both server and client Web applications. It supports major Internet transport, data format, and service description standards like HTTP and HTTPS, SMTP, XML, JSON, Atom, and WADL. A GWT port of the client-side library is also available.",
      "website": "http://www.restlet.org/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/Restlet.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Java"
    },
    {
      "id": "54",
      "name": "RESTRack",
      "summary": "A Model-View-Controller Framework. RESTRack follows the MVC design pattern that you are already familiar with.  It is inspired by Rails and follows a few of its conventions. But, while Rails is a powerful tool for full web applications, RESTRack is targeted at super lightweight data services.\nRack aims to provide a minimal API for connecting web servers and web frameworks. RESTRack leverages ",
      "details": "A Model-View-Controller Framework. RESTRack follows the MVC design pattern that you are already familiar with.  It is inspired by Rails and follows a few of its conventions. But, while Rails is a powerful tool for full web applications, RESTRack is targeted at super lightweight data services.\nRack aims to provide a minimal API for connecting web servers and web frameworks. RESTRack leverages Rack to provide a minimal framework to create REST services.  From the get go, RESTRack was designed to make it extremely easy to develop performant REST data services.\nRESTRack is perfect for data generation. Rich JavaScript frameworks such as ExtJS, jQuery UI, dojo, and native mobile applications would be well suited to for RESTRack serving as the data layer. The framework has a very small memory footprint, making it a great choice for cloud type architectures.",
      "website": "http://restrack.me/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/REST-Rack-Logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,REST,Ruby"
    },
    {
      "id": "52",
      "name": "RESTx",
      "summary": "\n\n\nThe simplest way to create RESTful web services \n\n\nProvide programmatic access to legacy data or applications over REST with a few lines of Java or Python.\n\n\nBuild self-documenting REST APIs that are automatically discoverable and browsable.\n\n\nCreate rich data services by integrating different data sources.\n\n\nAllow users to create their own data resources through the browser with a couple of cl",
      "details": "\n\n\nThe simplest way to create RESTful web services \n\n\nProvide programmatic access to legacy data or applications over REST with a few lines of Java or Python.\n\n\nBuild self-documenting REST APIs that are automatically discoverable and browsable.\n\n\nCreate rich data services by integrating different data sources.\n\n\nAllow users to create their own data resources through the browser with a couple of clicks.\n\n\nRESTx is a light-weight open-source platform for the creation of RESTful data access and integration resources and web services. It emphasizes simplicity, sane defaults and out-of-the-box usability. No complex configuration, no steep learning curve: You will be up and running in just 5 minutes.\nRESTx is not your usual application framework! Come see how RESTx is different and how it simplifies the creation of RESTful web services and resources.\nNew! Check out the interactive, online RESTx demo and see how quick and simple the creation of RESTful web services can be.\n\n\n\n",
      "website": "http://restx.mulesoft.org/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/RESTx.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Java,Python"
    },
    {
      "id": "49",
      "name": "Roar",
      "summary": "Roar is a framework for parsing and rendering REST documents. Nothing more. With Roar, REST documents – also known as representations – are defined using a new concept called representers. Both syntax and semantics are declared in Ruby modules that can be mixed into your domain models, following clean OOP patterns.\nRoar comes with built-in JSON, JSON::HAL and XML support. It exposes a ",
      "details": "Roar is a framework for parsing and rendering REST documents. Nothing more. With Roar, REST documents – also known as representations – are defined using a new concept called representers. Both syntax and semantics are declared in Ruby modules that can be mixed into your domain models, following clean OOP patterns.\nRoar comes with built-in JSON, JSON::HAL and XML support. It exposes a highly modular architecture and makes it very simple to add new media types and functionality where needed. Additional features include client HTTP support, coercion, client-side caching, awesome hypermedia support and more. Representers fit pretty well in DCI environments, too.\nRoar is completely framework-agnostic and loves being used in web kits like Rails, Webmachine, Sinatra, Padrino, etc. Actually, Roar makes it fun designing real, hypermedia-driven, and resource-oriented systems that will even make Steve sleep happily at night so he finally gets some REST!",
      "website": "https://github.com/apotonick/roar",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/download-github-logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,REST,Ruby"
    },
    {
      "id": "43",
      "name": "Seam REST",
      "summary": "Seam REST is a lightweight module that aims to provide additional integration with technologies within the Java EE platform as well as third party technologies. Seam REST is independent of CDI and JAX-RS implementations and thus fully portable between Java EE 6 environments.",
      "details": "Seam REST is a lightweight module that aims to provide additional integration with technologies within the Java EE platform as well as third party technologies. Seam REST is independent of CDI and JAX-RS implementations and thus fully portable between Java EE 6 environments.",
      "website": "http://seamframework.org/Seam3/RESTModule",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/Seam-Rest-Logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Java,REST"
    },
    {
      "id": "23",
      "name": "Slim",
      "summary": "What began as a weekend project became a simple yet powerful PHP 5 framework to create RESTful web applications. The Slim micro framework is everything you need and nothing you don’t. Slim lets you build a complete PHP web service with only a single PHP file. Features include: RESTful routing, Named routes, Route passing, Route redirects, Route halting, Custom views, HTTP caching, Signed coo",
      "details": "What began as a weekend project became a simple yet powerful PHP 5 framework to create RESTful web applications. The Slim micro framework is everything you need and nothing you don’t. Slim lets you build a complete PHP web service with only a single PHP file. Features include: RESTful routing, Named routes, Route passing, Route redirects, Route halting, Custom views, HTTP caching, Signed cookies, Custom 404 page, Custom 500 page, Error handling and Logging.",
      "website": "http://www.slimframework.com/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/Slim.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,PHP,REST,Slim"
    },
    {
      "id": "39",
      "name": "Spring Framework",
      "summary": "The Spring Framework provides a comprehensive programming and configuration model for modern Java-based enterprise applications - on any kind of deployment platform. A key element of Spring is infrastructural support at the application level: Spring focuses on the \"plumbing\" of enterprise applications so that teams can focus on application-level business logic, without unnecessary ties to specific",
      "details": "The Spring Framework provides a comprehensive programming and configuration model for modern Java-based enterprise applications - on any kind of deployment platform. A key element of Spring is infrastructural support at the application level: Spring focuses on the \"plumbing\" of enterprise applications so that teams can focus on application-level business logic, without unnecessary ties to specific deployment environments.",
      "website": "http://www.springsource.org/spring-framework",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/spring-logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Java"
    },
    {
      "id": "48",
      "name": "Taffy",
      "summary": "Taffy is a ColdFusion framework that helps you build RESTful web services with very little boilerplate code, very little configuration, and to be honest, very little effort.",
      "details": "Taffy is a ColdFusion framework that helps you build RESTful web services with very little boilerplate code, very little configuration, and to be honest, very little effort.",
      "website": "http://atuttle.github.com/Taffy/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/Taffy-Logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Cold Fusion,Framework"
    },
    {
      "id": "24",
      "name": "Tonic",
      "summary": "Tonic is an open source less is more, RESTful Web application development PHP library, where everything useful is a resource, not a file, not a CGI script, a resource, an abstract concept of something useful that the client wants to grab hold of.  Resources are located by URLs, URLs are cheap and form the universal addressing system of the Web.  Tonic helps you develop Web applications t",
      "details": "Tonic is an open source less is more, RESTful Web application development PHP library, where everything useful is a resource, not a file, not a CGI script, a resource, an abstract concept of something useful that the client wants to grab hold of.  Resources are located by URLs, URLs are cheap and form the universal addressing system of the Web.  Tonic helps you develop Web applications that embrace the way the Web really works, enabling your applications to scale, extend and work with other systems easily.",
      "website": "http://peej.github.com/tonic/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/Tonic-API-Framework-150x139.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,PHP,Tonic"
    },
    {
      "id": "50",
      "name": "web py",
      "summary": "web.py is a web framework for Python that is as simple as it is powerful. web.py is in the public domain; you can use it for whatever purpose with absolutely no restrictions.",
      "details": "web.py is a web framework for Python that is as simple as it is powerful. web.py is in the public domain; you can use it for whatever purpose with absolutely no restrictions.",
      "website": "http://webpy.org/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/webpy-logo.gif",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Python"
    },
    {
      "id": "25",
      "name": "Zend",
      "summary": "Zend_Rest_Server is intended as a fully-featured REST server.  To call a Zend_Rest_Server service, you must supply a GET and POST methods, with a value that is the method you wish to call. You can then follow that up with any number of arguments using either the name of the argument or using arg following by the numeric position of the argument. When returning values, you can return a custom ",
      "details": "Zend_Rest_Server is intended as a fully-featured REST server.  To call a Zend_Rest_Server service, you must supply a GET and POST methods, with a value that is the method you wish to call. You can then follow that up with any number of arguments using either the name of the argument or using arg following by the numeric position of the argument. When returning values, you can return a custom status, you may return an array with each status.",
      "website": "http://framework.zend.com/manual/en/zend.rest.server.html",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/ZendFramework-logo-150x39.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,PHP,Zend"
    }
  ],
  "published": "04/30/2013"
}

response.name: Model
response.body:
{
  "tools": [
    {
      "id": "53",
      "name": "Bottle",
      "summary": "Bottle is a fast, simple and lightweight WSGI micro web-framework for Python. It is distributed as a single file module and has no dependencies other than the Python Standard Library.\n\nRouting: Requests to function-call mapping with support for clean and dynamic URLs.\nTemplates: Fast and pythonic built-in template engine and support for mako, jinja",
      "details": "Bottle is a fast, simple and lightweight WSGI micro web-framework for Python. It is distributed as a single file module and has no dependencies other than the Python Standard Library.\n\nRouting: Requests to function-call mapping with support for clean and dynamic URLs.\nTemplates: Fast and pythonic built-in template engine and support for mako, jinja2 andcheetah templates.\nUtilities: Convenient access to form data, file uploads, cookies, headers and other HTTP-related metadata.\nServer: Built-in HTTP development server and support for paste, fapws3, bjoern, Google App Engine, cherrypy or any other WSGI capable HTTP server.\n",
      "website": "http://bottlepy.org/docs/dev/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/bottle-logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,API-Deployment,Framework,Python"
    },
    {
      "id": "4",
      "name": "CherryPy",
      "summary": "CherryPy is a pythonic, object-oriented HTTP framework, that allows developers to build web applications in much the same way they would build any other object-oriented Python program. This results in smaller source code developed in less time.\nCherryPy is now more than six years old and it is has proven very fast and stable. It is being used in production by many sites, from the simplest one",
      "details": "CherryPy is a pythonic, object-oriented HTTP framework, that allows developers to build web applications in much the same way they would build any other object-oriented Python program. This results in smaller source code developed in less time.\nCherryPy is now more than six years old and it is has proven very fast and stable. It is being used in production by many sites, from the simplest ones to the most demanding ones.",
      "website": "http://www.cherrypy.org/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/cherrypy_logo_big.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Python"
    },
    {
      "id": "3",
      "name": "Dave",
      "summary": "DAVE is a minimalist, multi-node, transactional API framework written in PHP.Dave contains an end-to-end API test suite for TDD, a Task model, an Active Database Model, and a stand-alone development server ( PHP) to get you started.DAVE is an acronym that stands for Delete, Add, Edit, and View. These 4 methods make up the core functionality of many transactional web applications. The DAVE API aims",
      "details": "DAVE is a minimalist, multi-node, transactional API framework written in PHP.Dave contains an end-to-end API test suite for TDD, a Task model, an Active Database Model, and a stand-alone development server ( PHP) to get you started.DAVE is an acronym that stands for Delete, Add, Edit, and View. These 4 methods make up the core functionality of many transactional web applications. The DAVE API aims to simplify and abstract may of the common tasks that these types of APIs require. DAVE does the work for you, and he's not CRUD. Dave was built to be both easy to use, but to be as simple as possible. I was tired of bloated frameworks that were designed to be monolithic applications which include M's, V's, and C's together in a single running application. As applications grow and become more 'service oriented', this is the eventual route which many applications go. I wanted to make is as simple as possible to create a new application with this mindset, and to allow for future flexibility.The DAVE API defines a single access point and accepts GET, POST, or COOKIE input. You define \"Action's\" that handle the input, such as \"AddUser\" or \"GeoLocate\". The DAVE API is NOT \"RESTful\", in that it does not use the normal verbs (Get, Put, etc) and uses a single /path/. This was chosen to make it as simple as possible for devices/users to access the functions, including low-level embedded devices which may have trouble with all the HTTP verbs. To see how simple it is to handle basic actions, this package comes with a basic user system included. Look in /Actions/examples to see the logic behind adding, editing, viewing, and deleting users. This includes log in. Restful paths are optional if you really must have them, and be defined per Action.The DAVE API understands 2 types of security methodology. \"Public\" actions can be called by anyone, and then can implement optional user-based security (checking userIDs and PasswordHashes?). Optionally, certain Actions can be defined as \"Private\", and will require a defined developer to authenticate with every request. This requires your developers to provide an MD5 hash of their APIKey and private DeveloperID to authenticate with. You can mix private and public actions. Of course, you can make your own actions for this as well!Dave contains an end-to-end API test suite for TDD, a Task model, an Active Database Model, and a stand-alone development server (written in just PHP) to get you started.",
      "website": "https://github.com/evantahler/PHP-DAVE-API",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/github-logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,PHP"
    },
    {
      "id": "5",
      "name": "Django Rest",
      "summary": "Django REST framework is a lightweight REST framework for Django, that aims to make it easy to build well-connected, self-describing RESTful Web APIs.Features Include:\n\nAutomatically provides an awesome Django admin style browse-able self-documenting API.\nClean, simple, views for Resources, using Django’s new class based views.\nSupport for ModelResources with out-of-the-box default implement",
      "details": "Django REST framework is a lightweight REST framework for Django, that aims to make it easy to build well-connected, self-describing RESTful Web APIs.Features Include:\n\nAutomatically provides an awesome Django admin style browse-able self-documenting API.\nClean, simple, views for Resources, using Django’s new class based views.\nSupport for ModelResources with out-of-the-box default implementations and input validation.\nPluggable parsers, renderers, authentication and permissions - Easy to customise.\nContent type negotiation using HTTP Accept headers.\nOptional support for forms as input validation.\nModular architecture - MixIn classes can be used without requiring the Resource or ModelResource classes.\n",
      "website": "http://django-rest-framework.org/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/Django-REST-Framework-Logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Django,Framework,Python"
    },
    {
      "id": "2",
      "name": "Epiphany",
      "summary": "The Epiphany framework is fast, easy, clean and RESTful. The framework does not do a lot of magic under the hood. It is, by design, very simple and very powerful.The documentation provides a few conventions that we believe lead to well written code but you're free to use any style you'd like. The framework never dictates how you should write or structure your application.",
      "details": "The Epiphany framework is fast, easy, clean and RESTful. The framework does not do a lot of magic under the hood. It is, by design, very simple and very powerful.The documentation provides a few conventions that we believe lead to well written code but you're free to use any style you'd like. The framework never dictates how you should write or structure your application.",
      "website": "https://github.com/jmathai/epiphany#readme",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/github-logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,PHP"
    },
    {
      "id": "6",
      "name": "Flask",
      "summary": "Flask is a microframework for Python based on Werkzeug, Jinja 2 and good intentions. And before you ask: It's BSD licensed!\nFlask’s documentation is divided into different parts.  They recommend that you get started with Installation and then head over to the Quickstart. Besides the quickstart there is also a more detailed Tutorial that shows how to create a com",
      "details": "Flask is a microframework for Python based on Werkzeug, Jinja 2 and good intentions. And before you ask: It's BSD licensed!\nFlask’s documentation is divided into different parts.  They recommend that you get started with Installation and then head over to the Quickstart. Besides the quickstart there is also a more detailed Tutorial that shows how to create a complete (albeit small) application with Flask. If you’d rather dive into the internals of Flask, check out the APIdocumentation. Common patterns are described in the Patterns for Flask section.\nFlask depends on two external libraries: the Jinja2 template engine and the Werkzeug WSGI toolkit. These libraries are not documented here. ",
      "website": "http://flask.pocoo.org/docs/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/flask-python-framework.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Python"
    },
    {
      "id": "1",
      "name": "FRAPI",
      "summary": "FRAPI is a new type of framework that embraces the standards and mindset of how the web is modeled. Instead of being a general purpose framework like the Zend Framework, Symfony, Cake, Lithium, etc. which are great for building web applications, FRAPI aims at removing the whole frontend layer complexity that handling REST calls can bring.\nFRAPI is a RESTful API Framework that allows developers to ",
      "details": "FRAPI is a new type of framework that embraces the standards and mindset of how the web is modeled. Instead of being a general purpose framework like the Zend Framework, Symfony, Cake, Lithium, etc. which are great for building web applications, FRAPI aims at removing the whole frontend layer complexity that handling REST calls can bring.\nFRAPI is a RESTful API Framework that allows developers to rapidly develop RESTful APIs that are easily scalable and highly performant. FRAPI consists of two specific parts: The administration interface and the public API.",
      "website": "http://getfrapi.com/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/FRAPI-Framwork.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,PHP,Zend"
    },
    {
      "id": "36",
      "name": "Grape",
      "summary": "Grape is a REST-like API micro-framework for Ruby. It's designed to run on Rack or complement existing web application frameworks such as Rails and Sinatra by providing a simple DSL to easily develop RESTful APIs. It has built-in support for common conventions, including multiple formats, subdomain/prefix restriction, content negotiation, versioning and much more.",
      "details": "Grape is a REST-like API micro-framework for Ruby. It's designed to run on Rack or complement existing web application frameworks such as Rails and Sinatra by providing a simple DSL to easily develop RESTful APIs. It has built-in support for common conventions, including multiple formats, subdomain/prefix restriction, content negotiation, versioning and much more.",
      "website": "http://rdoc.info/github/intridea/grape",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/download-github-logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Ruby"
    },
    {
      "id": "28",
      "name": "Limonade",
      "summary": "Limonade is a PHP micro framework for rapid web development and prototyping.  It’s inspired by frameworks like Sinatra or Camping in Ruby, or Orbit in Lua. It aims to be simple, lightweight and extremly flexible.",
      "details": "Limonade is a PHP micro framework for rapid web development and prototyping.  It’s inspired by frameworks like Sinatra or Camping in Ruby, or Orbit in Lua. It aims to be simple, lightweight and extremly flexible.",
      "website": "http://www.limonade-php.net/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/limonade.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Limonade,PHP,REST"

    {
      "id": "51",

      "summary": "The Pylons Project was founded by the people behind the Pylons web framework to develop web application framework technology in Python. Rather than focusing on a single web framework, the Pylons Project will develop a collection of related technologies. The first package is the Pyramid web framework.",
      "details": "The Pylons Project was founded by the people behind the Pylons web framework to develop web application framework technology in Python. Rather than focusing on a single web framework, the Pylons Project will develop a collection of related technologies. The first package is the Pyramid web framework.",
      "website": "http://www.pylonsproject.org/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/Pylons-Logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Python,REST"
    },
    {
      "id": "18",
      "name": "Recess",
      "summary": "Recess is a RESTful PHP framework that can be used by both beginner and seasoned developers. Recess is fast, light-weight, and has a very small footprint—ideal for LAMP development and drag-and-drop deployment to shared hosts. Recess is a modern framework that uses a loosely-coupled Model-View-Controller architecture designed and optimized specifically for PHP 5.",
      "details": "Recess is a RESTful PHP framework that can be used by both beginner and seasoned developers. Recess is fast, light-weight, and has a very small footprint—ideal for LAMP development and drag-and-drop deployment to shared hosts. Recess is a modern framework that uses a loosely-coupled Model-View-Controller architecture designed and optimized specifically for PHP 5.",
      "website": "http://www.recessframework.org/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/Recess-PHP-Framework-150x50.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,PHP,REST"
    },
    {
      "id": "45",
      "name": "Resteasy",
      "summary": "Resteasy is a JBoss.org project aimed at providing productivity frameworks for developing client and server RESTful applications and services in Java.  It is mainly a JAX-RS implementation but you'll find some other experimental code in the repository.",
      "details": "Resteasy is a JBoss.org project aimed at providing productivity frameworks for developing client and server RESTful applications and services in Java.  It is mainly a JAX-RS implementation but you'll find some other experimental code in the repository.",
      "website": "http://www.jboss.org/resteasy",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/REST-Easy.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Java,REST"
    },
    {
      "id": "47",
      "name": "RestFixture",
      "summary": "The RestFixture is a FitNesse fixture that allows developers, testers, and/or product owners to write test fixtures for REST API with simplicity in mind. The idea is to write tests that are self-documenting and easy to write and read, without the need to write Java code.\nThe fixture allows test writers to express tests as actions (using any of the allowed HTTP methods) to ",
      "details": "The RestFixture is a FitNesse fixture that allows developers, testers, and/or product owners to write test fixtures for REST API with simplicity in mind. The idea is to write tests that are self-documenting and easy to write and read, without the need to write Java code.\nThe fixture allows test writers to express tests as actions (using any of the allowed HTTP methods) to operate on resource URIs and to express expectations about the content of the return code, headers and body. All without writing one single line of Java code!",
      "website": "https://github.com/smartrics/RestFixture/wiki",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/download-github-logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Java,REST"
    },
    {
      "id": "41",
      "name": "Restify",
      "summary": "restify is a node.js module built specifically to enable you to build correct REST web services. It intentionally borrows heavily from express as that is more or less the de facto API for writing web applications on top of node.js.",
      "details": "restify is a node.js module built specifically to enable you to build correct REST web services. It intentionally borrows heavily from express as that is more or less the de facto API for writing web applications on top of node.js.",
      "website": "http://mcavage.github.com/node-restify/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/Restify-Logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Node.js,REST"
    },
    {
      "id": "38",
      "name": "RESTkit",
      "summary": "RestKit is an Objective-C framework for iOS that aims to make interacting with RESTful web services simple, fast and fun. It combines a clean, simple HTTP request/response API with a powerful object mapping system that reduces the amount of code you need to write to get stuff done.",
      "details": "RestKit is an Objective-C framework for iOS that aims to make interacting with RESTful web services simple, fast and fun. It combines a clean, simple HTTP request/response API with a powerful object mapping system that reduces the amount of code you need to write to get stuff done.",
      "website": "http://restkit.org/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/RestKit-Logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Objective-C"
    },
    {
      "id": "26",
      "name": "Restler",
      "summary": "A RESTful API server framework that is written in PHP that aids your mobile / web / desktop applications. A framework, but with a difference – Restler is all here to bend and mend to your needs.\nWriting Server made easy and light. With the light weight, Restler makes writing a server as easy as writing it with just 3 PHP files.\nRestler’s advantage is the simplicity. You can create a PH",
      "details": "A RESTful API server framework that is written in PHP that aids your mobile / web / desktop applications. A framework, but with a difference – Restler is all here to bend and mend to your needs.\nWriting Server made easy and light. With the light weight, Restler makes writing a server as easy as writing it with just 3 PHP files.\nRestler’s advantage is the simplicity. You can create a PHP class with some functions to expose.  If you know how to write object oriented PHP, then you already know how to use Restler. It’s action speaks for its effectiveness.\nRestler is all about being light and easy. All public methods are automatically mapped to a URL Tailor-made Restler is known for the customization options. You just need to write class and add methods in PHP. It is just there!.\nRestler makes it effective and facilitates your customizing needs. It goes ahead to leverage your designing creativities. A plugin architecture is used:\n\nfor supporting different formats like json, xml, yaml, amf, plist is used, which also means that you can add your own formats easily\nfor supporting different authentication schemes and you can add your own auth plugin\n\nWhile designing your application, RESTful server makes use of the Web’s well known architecture to your benefit.\nYou just need to simply declare the function as protected and add an authentication class Most of all, an obvious benefit with Restler is, it is free and open sourced.",
      "website": "http://luracast.com/products/restler/",
      "logo": "",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,PHP"
    },
    {
      "id": "42",
      "name": "Restlet",
      "summary": "Restlet is a lightweight, comprehensive, open source REST framework for the Java platform. Restlet is suitable for both server and client Web applications. It supports major Internet transport, data format, and service description standards like HTTP and HTTPS, SMTP, XML, JSON, Atom, and WADL. A GWT port of the client-side ",
      "details": "Restlet is a lightweight, comprehensive, open source REST framework for the Java platform. Restlet is suitable for both server and client Web applications. It supports major Internet transport, data format, and service description standards like HTTP and HTTPS, SMTP, XML, JSON, Atom, and WADL. A GWT port of the client-side library is also available.",
      "website": "http://www.restlet.org/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/Restlet.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Java"
    },
    {
      "id": "54",
      "name": "RESTRack",
      "summary": "A Model-View-Controller Framework. RESTRack follows the MVC design pattern that you are already familiar with.  It is inspired by Rails and follows a few of its conventions. But, while Rails is a powerful tool for full web applications, RESTRack is targeted at super lightweight data services.\nRack aims to provide a minimal API for connecting web servers and web frameworks. RESTRack leverages ",
      "details": "A Model-View-Controller Framework. RESTRack follows the MVC design pattern that you are already familiar with.  It is inspired by Rails and follows a few of its conventions. But, while Rails is a powerful tool for full web applications, RESTRack is targeted at super lightweight data services.\nRack aims to provide a minimal API for connecting web servers and web frameworks. RESTRack leverages Rack to provide a minimal framework to create REST services.  From the get go, RESTRack was designed to make it extremely easy to develop performant REST data services.\nRESTRack is perfect for data generation. Rich JavaScript frameworks such as ExtJS, jQuery UI, dojo, and native mobile applications would be well suited to for RESTRack serving as the data layer. The framework has a very small memory footprint, making it a great choice for cloud type architectures.",
      "website": "http://restrack.me/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/REST-Rack-Logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,REST,Ruby"
    },
    {
      "id": "52",
      "name": "RESTx",
      "summary": "\n\n\nThe simplest way to create RESTful web services \n\n\nProvide programmatic access to legacy data or applications over REST with a few lines of Java or Python.\n\n\nBuild self-documenting REST APIs that are automatically discoverable and browsable.\n\n\nCreate rich data services by integrating different data sources.\n\n\nAllow users to create their own data resources through the browser with a couple of cl",
      "details": "\n\n\nThe simplest way to create RESTful web services \n\n\nProvide programmatic access to legacy data or applications over REST with a few lines of Java or Python.\n\n\nBuild self-documenting REST APIs that are automatically discoverable and browsable.\n\n\nCreate rich data services by integrating different data sources.\n\n\nAllow users to create their own data resources through the browser with a couple of clicks.\n\n\nRESTx is a light-weight open-source platform for the creation of RESTful data access and integration resources and web services. It emphasizes simplicity, sane defaults and out-of-the-box usability. No complex configuration, no steep learning curve: You will be up and running in just 5 minutes.\nRESTx is not your usual application framework! Come see how RESTx is different and how it simplifies the creation of RESTful web services and resources.\nNew! Check out the interactive, online RESTx demo and see how quick and simple the creation of RESTful web services can be.\n\n\n\n",
      "website": "http://restx.mulesoft.org/",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/RESTx.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Java,Python"
    },
    {
      "id": "49",
      "name": "Roar",
      "summary": "Roar is a framework for parsing and rendering REST documents. Nothing more. With Roar, REST documents – also known as representations – are defined using a new concept called representers. Both syntax and semantics are declared in Ruby modules that can be mixed into your domain models, following clean OOP patterns.\nRoar comes with built-in JSON, JSON::HAL and XML support. It exposes a ",
      "details": "Roar is a framework for parsing and rendering REST documents. Nothing more. With Roar, REST documents – also known as representations – are defined using a new concept called representers. Both syntax and semantics are declared in Ruby modules that can be mixed into your domain models, following clean OOP patterns.\nRoar comes with built-in JSON, JSON::HAL and XML support. It exposes a highly modular architecture and makes it very simple to add new media types and functionality where needed. Additional features include client HTTP support, coercion, client-side caching, awesome hypermedia support and more. Representers fit pretty well in DCI environments, too.\nRoar is completely framework-agnostic and loves being used in web kits like Rails, Webmachine, Sinatra, Padrino, etc. Actually, Roar makes it fun designing real, hypermedia-driven, and resource-oriented systems that will even make Steve sleep happily at night so he finally gets some REST!",
      "website": "https://github.com/apotonick/roar",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/download-github-logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,REST,Ruby"
    },
    {
      "id": "43",
      "name": "Seam REST",
      "summary": "Seam REST is a lightweight module that aims to provide additional integration with technologies within the Java EE platform as well as third party technologies. Seam REST is independent of CDI and JAX-RS implementations and thus fully portable between Java EE 6 environments.",
      "details": "Seam REST is a lightweight module that aims to provide additional integration with technologies within the Java EE platform as well as third party technologies. Seam REST is independent of CDI and JAX-RS implementations and thus fully portable between Java EE 6 environments.",
      "website": "http://seamframework.org/Seam3/RESTModule",
      "logo": "http://kinlane-productions.s3.amazonaws.com/api-evangelist-site/tools/Seam-Rest-Logo.png",
      "tags": "API Deployment,Framework,Java,REST"
    },
    {
      "id": "23",
      "name": "Slim",
      "summary": "What began as a weekend project became a simple yet powerful PHP 5 framework to create RESTful web applications. The Slim micro framework is everything you need and nothing you don’t. Slim lets you build a complete PHP web service with only a single PHP file.       "name": "Tonic",
      "summary": "Tonic is an open source less is more, RESTful Web application development PHP library, where everything useful is a resource, not a file, not a CGI script, a resource, an abstract concept of something useful that the client wants to grab hold of.  Resources are located by URLs, URLs are cheap and form the universal addressing system of the Web.  Tonic helps you develop Web applications t",
      "details": "Tonic is an open source less is more, RESTful Web application development PHP library, where everything useful is a resource, not a file, not a CGI script, a resource, an abstract concept of something useful that the client wants to grab hold of.  Resources are located by URLs, URLs are cheap and form the universal addressing system of the Web.  Tonic helps you develop Web applications that embrace the way the Web really works, enabling your applications to scale, extend and work with other systems easily.",
